intro: Deiregyne obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, waxy leaves and a single, tall flowering stem that bears a composite flower head. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into white, fluffy seeds with parachute-like structures for wind dispersal. Native to temperate regions of Asia, it is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Deiregyne obtusa is a hardy perennial that thrives in a variety of soil types and is relatively easy to cultivate.
